oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1959-10-10 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from October 10, 1959. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Jim Reeves (host/performer), guest performer Mac Wiseman, and regular performers the Jordanaires, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, Archie Campbell, and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1044th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jim Reeves; Jordanaires; Mac Wiseman; Tommy Jackson; Jimmie Selph; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Jim Reeves -- Billy Bayou (Jim Reeves) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Jim Reeves) -- Grant Turner introduces the Jordanaires -- One Of These Mornings (Jordanaires) -- Jim Reeves introduces Mac Wiseman -- Jimmy Brown The Newsboy (Mac Wiseman, Jordanaires) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Jim Reeves) -- Grant Turner introduces Tommy Jackson -- Fisher's Hornpipe (Tommy Jackson fiddle, Jimmie Selph calls) -- Grant Turner introduces Jim Reeves -- An Evening Prayer (Jim Reeves) -- Jim Reeves introduces Chet Atkins -- Pagan Love Song (Chet Atkins)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Sloan, Ralph; Tennessee Travelers; Campbell, Archie; Atkins, Chet; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Jackson, Tommy; Jordanaires (Musical group); Selph, Jimmy; Reeves, Jim; Wiseman, Mac; Tubb, Ernest, 1914-1984
